summary: The state of Texas is divided into 254 counties.
full_text:
Real County  is a county located on the Edwards Plateau in the U.S. state of Texas. As of the 2010 census, its population was 3,309. The county seat is Leakey. The county is named for Julius Real , a former member of the Texas State Senate.
The Alto Frio Baptist Encampment is located in an isolated area of Real County southeast of Leakey.
title: Real County, Texas
